column4: Does Ubuntu use "devfs"?  I'm installing openvpn, and the installer want to know if I want to create a TUN/TAP device.  It says I should refuse if I am using devfs.
Does that answer the question about using "devfs"?
Hello, world.
I'm mucking around with openvpn, and I don't really know what I'm doing.
Once I have openvpn running, how do I use it?
How would I login in to my office computer on the remote network if I am connected to a vpn server?
the ports would need to be open by whoever set up the vpn
...and?
use your favorite ssh client or vnc to connect
Sorry, I really don't know much about how vpn works.  All I know now is that I was told that ssh has been disabled, and I have to use vpn.
jdub: OK, I'll check out vnc.
did your network admin tell you what vpn client to use?
All I have so far is the ip address.  When I said my home computer runs linux, the tech guy that said, basically, "Oh. Sorry, I can't help you"
oooo...are you good at vpn tunnelling?
I'm as good at that as I am at brain surgery.
I gave up trying to hit our VPN with my linux box...I just use my windows box..its easier
Hmm...  I don't have a windows box.
the box you have to connect to at work a windows box?
Both my home computer and the computer that I ultimately want to connect to are linux.  Presumably the vpn server that I have to go through is windows.
Don't forget, I may have a completely incorrect picture of how this is supposed to work.
